main event: A civilian amateur astronomer spotted a triangular-shaped UFO near Monticello, New York on July 22, 1955.
interesting points: The UFO was described as triangular in shape, about 1 foot in length, and appeared white with a red nose and a bright light at the center.
The UFO was first sighted at an angle of 40-50 degrees above the horizon, then reappeared at an angle of 5-10 degrees above the horizon before fading out and passing over the horizon.
The UFO exhibited fast, zigzagging, and flashing movements, described as the 'fastest thing in the sky'.
The sighting lasted for about 2 minutes initially, then the UFO reappeared about 20 minutes later for another 5 minutes.
The observer was a 13-year-old civilian amateur astronomer, who was considered to be above average in reliability for his age.
